Microbe-to-sample-data correlation heatmap

Source: R/heatmaps.R
heatmaps.Rd

Correlate microbial abundances to numeric sample_data variables

cor_heatmap(
  data,
  taxa = NA,
  anno_tax = NULL,
  vars = NA,
  cor = c("pearson", "kendall", "spearman")[1],
  cor_use = "everything",
  colors = heat_palette(palette = "Green-Orange", sym = TRUE),
  numbers = heat_numbers(),
  taxa_which = "row",
  seriation_method = "OLO_ward",
  seriation_dist = "euclidean",
  seriation_method_col = seriation_method,
  seriation_dist_col = seriation_dist,
  tax_transform = "identity",
  ...
)

Arguments

data

phyloseq or phyloseq extra
taxa

list of taxa to include, or NA for all
anno_tax

taxAnnotation output describing taxa distribution or NULL
vars

selection of variable names from sample_data
cor

name of correlation method
cor_use

passed to cor(use = cor_use)
colors

output of heat_palette() to set heatmap fill color scheme
numbers

output of heat_numbers() to draw numbers on heatmap cells
taxa_which

row or column (which represents a taxon)
seriation_method

method to order the rows (in seriation::seriate)
seriation_dist

distance to use in seriation_method (if needed)
seriation_method_col

method to order the columns (in seriation::seriate)
seriation_dist_col

distance to use in seriation_method_col (if needed)
tax_transform

transformation applied to otu_table before correlating (and BEFORE selection of taxa)
...

extra args, for cor_heatmap passed to viz_heatmap (for heat_numbers() dots are passed to grid::gpar for grid::grid.text)

Examples

library(dplyr)
data("dietswap", package = "microbiome")
# create a couple of numerical variables to use
psq <- dietswap %>%
  ps_mutate(
    weight = recode(bmi_group, obese = 3, overweight = 2, lean = 1),
    female = if_else(sex == "female", true = 1, false = 0),
    african = if_else(nationality == "AFR", true = 1, false = 0)
  )
psq <- tax_filter(ps = psq, min_prevalence = 1 / 10, min_sample_abundance = 1 / 10)

#> Proportional min_prevalence given: 0.1 --> min 23/222 samples.
psq <- tax_agg(psq, "Genus") %>% ps_get()

set.seed(123)
taxa <- sample(microbiome::top_taxa(psq)[1:50], size = 30)

p <- cor_heatmap(psq, taxa, anno_tax = taxAnnotation(psq, taxa, undetected = 50))

#> Error: .onLoad failed in loadNamespace() for 'Cairo', details:
#>   call: dyn.load(file, DLLpath = DLLpath, ...)
#>   error: unable to load shared object '/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/Cairo/libs/Cairo.so':
#>   dlopen(/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/Cairo/libs/Cairo.so, 6): Library not loaded: /opt/X11/lib/libXrender.1.dylib
#>   Referenced from: /Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/Cairo/libs/Cairo.so
#>   Reason: image not found
p

#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'p' not found

p2 <- cor_heatmap(psq, taxa, anno_tax = taxAnnotation(psq, taxa, undetected = 50, which = "column"), taxa_which = "column")

#> Error: .onLoad failed in loadNamespace() for 'Cairo', details:
#>   call: dyn.load(file, DLLpath = DLLpath, ...)
#>   error: unable to load shared object '/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/Cairo/libs/Cairo.so':
